flawed_nl_solution:
One-third of her bonus was $900/3 = $<<900/3=300>>300.
After one year, stock A doubled in value and was worth $300*2 = $<<300*2=6000>>6000.
After one year, stock B doubled in value and was worth $300*2 = $<<300*2=600>>600.
After one year, stock C had lost half its value and was worth $300/2 = $<<300/2=150>>150.
Altogether, at the end of the year, Gwen's stocks were worth $6000+$600+$150 = $<<6000+600+150=6750>>6750
#### 6750

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 600, not 6000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
